title:MKB PvP !Backups Dupes - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.

// Bold Endings
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Bold Endings and by extension Warden's Law don't really fit in any particular play style. They have good range, good chunk damage, but behave more like a pulse rifle / Crimson. They're not bad but take away one of hand cannon’s strongest benefits, peek shooting. If you want to use this competitively, you'll want as consistent of a hand cannon as.possible. Rapid Hit and Eye of the Storm add much needed consistency, while To the Pain can pair well with Eye of the Storm for maximum AA / accuracy bonuses." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// The Call
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rocket-Assisted Frames are not super strong in PvP. Slice allows you to sever your opponents and get a bit of a damage advantage. Beacon Rounds adds some flexibility in your shots as it adds in tracking. Strategist is gonna be best if you're using a high class ability build. In terms.of the fourth column, Adrenaline Junkie or Desperate Measures are both easy to get 20% damage or more with ability usage. While it's more of an on / off weapon where without a damage perk it does pretty whelming damage, once you get an ability kill it can allow you to roll over teams easier." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3947966653&perks=2822142346,2859149211,3525010810,831391274
dimwishlist:item=3947966653&perks=2822142346,2859149211,3798852852,831391274
dimwishlist:item=3947966653&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2859149211,831391274

// No Hesitation
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "No Hesitations is not going to be strong in PvP. Investing entirely into range puts you at a respectable 32m at 75 range. The third column perks let us down. No Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Tap the Trigger, or even Kill Clip leaves other autos high and mighty over No Hesitations." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=2109543898,3142289711,3250034553,3523296417

// False Idols
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In the crucible you don't have a lot of great options. Unrelenting giving you health on double kills. Double kills being slightly easier with Chain Reaction. Aside from memes in 6v6 I don't see this weapon being used." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=2396489472,269888150,3108830275,3666208348

// Pro Memoria
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Pro Memoria having an incredibly quick 0.40s TtK at 5 crits ties Rapid-Fire frames for the fastest neutral TtK while also being easier to control. Hatchling allows for some chip damage on the next target and Strand synergy. Tap the Trigger giving you full bonuses for the entirety of your TtK." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in PvP Heavy Burst sidearms are a bit of a mixed bag. Perpetual Motion adds much needed stability by moving around, and unfortunately without a great kill perk in the fourth column we have Swashbuckler for melee builds, Adrenaline Junkie for grenade builds and Desperate Measures for any build." // Veiled Threat
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Bringing that model into PvP is asking for a blindspot. The entire right side of your screen is gone. Heaven forbid you ADS. Say goodbye to your peripherals. Desperate Measures is an easy damage bonus while Moving Target will make Veiled Threat stickier. It's not the most competitive auto rifle but I think you know that by now." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Aberrant Action
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rocket-Assisted sidearms do not have the same presence in PvP. Beacon Rounds adds some forgiveness in secondary kills but these weapons don't OHK. That alone means the ammo economy won't be the best. You can bump up the damage considerably with Radiant and Golden Tricorn, which with its solar synergy could allow for some really strong blinting or snowballing." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Corrasion
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "These weapons in PvP are a slight new breed. They're good with neutral damage bonus but Corrasion also doesn't have that. Focused Fury would be a good neutral damage perk if you can hit crits. You don't necessarily need a kill but you'll probably get one along the way." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Speleologist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in PvP you can take advantage of the blistering TtK at 0.40s with 7 crits on all resilience levels. One stack of Killing Tally adds forgiveness but if you manage to get 2 kills you’ll drop T4 resilience guardians in a blistering 0.33s (3 stacks of Killing Tally bring the resilience gate to T9). Incandescent would probably be my pick as you’re not trying to guess what resilience level your enemies are at and allows for some splash damage also making the second kill easier. You can also swap off this weapon allowing for a more fluid game experience." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Maahes HC4
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Maahes HC4 in the crucible isn’t as strong as a dedicated 120 or 140 hand cannon. These weapons lack the peek shooting capabilities and don’t out range the other archetypes falling somewhere between the two. You’ll want to boost the weapons stats via Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion or even Enlightened Action. Unrelenting stays up for a longer time than most players expect and can act as a pseudo Heal Clip when you chain kills. The easiest way to do that is with Golden Tricorn or Swashbuckler depending on the build you’re going for. Void builds should use Golden Tricorn to get to 2x allowing for a blistering 3c1b TtK at 0.57s. If you’re not going void but invest in strength or a melee build, Swashbuckler 5x allows for the same TtK but at 4c at all resilience levels. Golden Tricorn adds forgiveness but has the tradeoff of being slightly harder to pull off" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "The Riposte has better utility in PvP where Killing Wind, Tap the Trigger, or Zen Moment each bring more to the table than in the PvE arena. Target Lock or Kill Clip give you better consistency in each engagement or in the follow up ones. Dynamic Sway Reduction will give you incredible consistency especially paired with Tap the Trigger or Zen Moment in the third column. The Riposte really is a swiss army knife of autos." // Forbearance
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. Wellspring could pair well with Demolitionist for even more ability energy, or Desperate Measures for a damage bonus without needing a weapon kill to start." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=2822142346,3300816228,3525010810,469285294
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=2822142346,3300816228,3798852852,469285294
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=1441682018,2822142346,3300816228,469285294

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse’s defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2109543898,4071163871
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=1482024992,1561002382,2109543898,4071163871

// Hung Jury SR4
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Speaking of the crucible the curated roll is almost perfect, if you don't like Enlightened Action you could instead opt for No Distractions or Rapid Hit. Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the “gimmick” of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1453235079&perks=247725512,3038247973,3230963543,839105230

// Hammerhead
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over on the PvP side, machine guns haven't been high meta but they have always felt good. Hammerhead with Rewind Rounds and High-Impact Reserves will synergize well with the low ammo from the wall, and refund itself to get you a few more kills. If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. Over-Under is another good shout here to get rid of most players in rifts. I wouldn't mind hearing more Hammerheads in the crucible. At least I'd know where they are." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Blast Furnace
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later). Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Outbreak Perfected
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you would like to bring the nanites into PvP I would opt for one of two ways. Arrowhead Brake at the front end for added recoil direction, Accurized Rounds for the extra range. Headseeker or Rapid Hit depending on what you value, and your choice of Short-Action Stock for more handling or Hand-Laid Stock for the most stability. The alternative way is with Fitted Stock to bring you right up to 100 recoil direction meaning you can slot in Smallbore or even Hammer-Forged Rifling for more range. You drop some handling unless you make that up in your barrel."|tags:pvp,mkb

// Forbearance (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. Wellspring could pair well with Demolitionist for even more ability energy, or Desperate Measures for a damage bonus without needing a weapon kill to start." // The Mountaintop (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=4043921923&perks=2822142346,3300816228,3525010810,469285294

// The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse’s defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3098328572&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2109543898,4071163871

Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the “gimmick” of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "PvP has far less options but still some solid options. Instead of different niches within the grand scheme of PvE content, we really have consistency or lethality 2x. Within both you’ll find a healthy scoop of stability perks, either Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Perpetual Motion. Pick your poison there. If you want more consistency on top of your consistency sundae, go for Tap the Trigger. For lethality you can opt for Target Lock, Onslaught, or the tried and true Kill Clip. All options are great but work in different ways, your best option might not be the same as others so give them a try." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Judgment
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Judgment lost a little bit of its edge in the crucible. You can still get Slideshot and Opening Shot. It’s not that Judgment is bad, just that other weapons edged it out and 140’s aren’t exactly strong in this meta (for the first time in a while). Hitmark HCS, SteadyHand HCS, or FastDraw HCS are all great options and allow you to add some much needed stats and aim assist. I am surprised Bungie didn’t swap Judgment over to barrels. I guess hand cannon sights are easier than “sights” if that makes sense." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Multimach CCX
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Multimach is back and boy do I have conflicting views on this. Should we invest in lethality or consistency? Iron Reach will be incredible in 3v3 game modes, as well as Trials and potentially in Rumble, but Kill Clip will be even better for 6v6 game modes or slayers. Ideally you’ll find a healthy mix of range and stability, but Dynamic Sway Reduction will cover most of your stability if you opt for Iron Reach. If you prefer Kill Clip, then I would recommend Moving Target for better movement speed and being that quick slayer we all know you are." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don’t kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don’t really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you’ll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Taking Appetence into the crucible might be a big test of your patience. Already having low ammo, and the current economy of ammo bricks will severely limit your overall usage. If you can horde ammo bricks like Scrooge you can certainly make this weapon work better. Enlightened Action will make the weapon feel better, and Headstone can deny revives or build into the Stasis subclass like in PvE. Killing Tally can work if you use nothing but this trace rifle but I wouldn’t advise it." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "With such a similar pulse existing in PvP it comes down to perks. Forge’s Pledge gets access to Accurized and Steady Rounds, while Adhortative comes with High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds. Forge’s Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. Depending on your preferred play style you might prefer one over the other, but I cannot emphasize this enough: both can work wonders." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): " Lethophobia is already making a strong impression on crucible players everywhere being the first bow to roll Disruption Break. Paired with any kinetic weapon you can city shot and get a whopping 50% extra damage on any kinetic weapon from you or anyone on your team. This damage debuff stays applied for a full 5.5 seconds. Be on the lookout for the “Disrupted” debuff off your screen, you will be extra vulnerable for this time." Recommended MW: Accuracy.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna’s Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it’s not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought)." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Scalar Potential doesn’t reinvent the wheel. The perks unique to it aren’t useful in the crucible spare Enlightened Action which will make this pulse feel better but not help its lethality. Neutrally with Headseeker you could have a pulse that feels fantastic, but Keep Away will probably be better for the range and accuracy bonuses. If you like the model and sights I’d suggest grinding out the patterns, if you already have another rapid-fire frame pulse I wouldn’t worry too much about this one." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Breakneck
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Breakneck is one of those weapons where if you like it, you’ll use it everywhere no matter what. It isn’t incredible in the crucible, but it can hold its own as a precision frame auto rifle. Breakneck gets a touch of SUROS Regime by either speeding up the RPM post kill with Onslaught or slowing it down with Adagio. Depending on how you play, one might feel better than the other. If you’re not looking for a legendary SUROS I’d recommend consistency perks to have a reliable precision frame from gunfight to gunfight." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Parabellum
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Adaptive frame submachine guns are my favorite in PvP. They combine a good weapon feel with good damage too. The Hero’s Burden is amazing with Kill Clip. Parabellum gets two damage perks both with different feels. Adagio will give you forgiveness and keep your time to kill relatively the same. If you can activate Frenzy you’ll drop your time to kill down to a blistering 0.67s but you’ll have to keep Frenzy up in order to maintain that momentum. I have a difficult time playing the mini game of “Frenzy.”" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3926811686&perks=3142289711,3250034553,3673922083,3828510309
dimwishlist:item=3926811686&perks=1359896290,3142289711,3250034553,3828510309

// Ros Arago IV
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in the crucible it is slightly better and slightly worse than Gnawing Hunger. Instead of getting bonus damage through Kill Clip you can decrease your time to kill via Onslaught. With arguably a better accuracy perk in Dynamic Sway Reduction over Zen Moment. It ultimately will depend on which model you prefer as well as which version you’d like. Both technically have time to kill reducing post-kill perks as well as accuracy boosting perks." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3583275737&perks=1359896290,3142289711,839105230,95528736

// Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Belisarius-D comes from the crucible, and it belongs in the crucible. Rapid Hit and Headseeker are fantastic neutral perks that no one would argue belong together. Keep Away and Moving Target can substitute as well for a very strong neutral weapon. Eye of the Storm is conditional in that you will have to take damage, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks. In the crucible you will be taking damage, so getting some extra benefits alongside that is all upsides. Kill Clip doesn’t change the time to kill enough to be noticeable unless you hit nothing but headshots. In which case you’ll drop down to a 0.60 TtK with 6 crits on Tier 8 Resilience or below. Without Kill Clip on those higher tiered resilience levels you’ll need 1 extra bullet, either way it still remains a two-burst as you won’t stop the burst mid-burst." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Indebted Kindness
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Indebted Kindness is extremely interesting in the crucible. Impulse Amplifier can turn this into a near instant pseudo-grenade launcher shot, but I think most players are going to opt for Beacon Rounds for better tracking and hip-fire usage. The tracking isn’t incredible side to side, for when a Dawnblade flies across your screen, but for general strafing the tracking at low levels is great. At higher buffs you can start to get into a groove and be a bit more loose with your aim, but I wouldn’t rely heavily on the tracking. Adagio makes Indebted Kindness a reliable two shot, which I think feeds well into Beacon Rounds." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// The Guiding Sight - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Now, while you can 3 crit at 0.80 at nearly every distance. I don't think this scout will be really strong in the close range. Perpetual Motion and Enlightened Action will both boost your stats further and Kill Clip will allow you to 2 crit 1 body in the close range. It's not the strongest scout in the game. // Qua Xaphan V - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "There are not many uses for a high-impact machine gun in PvP. They require all crits but just feel extremely unforgiving. Anything to bump up the consistency will be greatly appreciated. Dynamic Sway Reduction or Under Pressure, and Ricochet Rounds will feel great. Rampage might not be the best but it does allow you to 3 crit 1 body any resilience and 2 crit 2 body all the way up to 7 resilience. Adrenaline Junkie isn't quite as strong on the low end. But if you can get a grenade kill you can 3 crit any resilience for a 0.33s TtK. Incredibly fast." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Unending Tempest - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Unending Tempest will be the next best submachine gun. Rivaling but not as strong as release The Immortal. The only issue is the large perk pool, but you can always work around that by playing crucible for more resets. The best perks depend on how you play. Killing Wind will help you get to and beat out your next engagement, Multikill Clip works here, but Kill Clip would have been better. Dynamic Sway Reduction will help keep your bullets on target paired with Target Lock for that quick TtK. Finally you could also try to hit max range with Fragile Focus and boost up your other stats with Perpetual Motion. It's definitely going to be a dominant SMG this season, and if you prefer precision SMGs like myself it will be worth the grind." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Deadpan Delivery - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "I'm not going to lie. I got excited by this shotgun for one mere fact. Slickdraw. I know it's not everyone's cup of tea, but it has been mine for the past season. I have been slowly collecting Slickdraw weapons and changing crafted weapons to utilize Slickdraw. Now I know Slickdraw reduces your auto-aim cone size; it just means you have to be a bit more accurate when aiming. You can achieve a similar effect of Slickdraw by going with Arc Elemental Capacitor, Barrel Shroud, a Handling MW, and Quick Access Sling for 96 handling. This gives you a ready speed of 0.20s and an aim down sights speed of 0.23s. However just having Slickdraw drops you to the same ready speed and drops a hundredth of a second off of aim down sights. This means you can invest every other stat point into range. Bungie knew what they were doing when bringing in this weapon as Deadpan Delivery has the second lowest range stat of all Aggressive Frame shotguns even losing to the Uncommon Ded Nemoris II." Recommended MW: Handling.| tags:mkb,pvp

// Kept Confidence - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "PvP is another story. There's really only one or two ways this hand cannon can work. You can either opt for a "win more" perk like Killing Wind or a more neutral perk like Quickdraw depending on how you play. Neither are exceptionally better than the other, but the main pairing for both is Eye of the Storm. Kept Confidence could have been released as a static weapon like Epochal Integration and people would still use the same perks. Your barrel and masterwork choice is really up to preference if you want more stability, handling, or range." Recommended MW: Range or Stability. tags:mkb,pvp

// Nightshade - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Nightshade in PvP has had an interesting run. From being a viable option in Vanilla, to being passed over with random rolls, to being an off meta choice in its revival, to being outclassed, and finally returning again. What a ride. Arrowhead Brake is again my choice in barrels, but if you can control the recoil direction you can certainly opt for other options. Ricochet Rounds is the best in slot whenever it is available so please choose that. High-Caliber Rounds can work but I find neutrally the bump in stability outweighs possibly flinching off my opponent. In the third column it is all about Keep Away. Being able to get a range bump for free is incredible. I prefer Kill Clip for an easier time 1v2'ing as I am usually in a bad situation, but Headseeker is better neutrally for any 1vX situation as it's always on. With my roll choices you can have 100 recoil direction with a counterbalance mod and 32m of in game range. Plenty to take advantage of the bonuses of Keep Away." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp
dimwishlist:item=1974641289&perks=1885400500,3619207468,460017080,839105230

// The Showrunner - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP The Showrunner is going to be the least used SMG this season right behind Unending Tempest. Go see why I think that SMG is better in the Vendor breakdown. The Showrunner has some great perks in Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction, Rangefinder if you're really looking for consistency at range, or more neutral perks like Well Rounded or Heating Up. However, the issue is really the frame we were given. Lightweight SMGs are not "in the spotlight." While I think this SMG can serve you well as a kinetic Funnelweb the perks to note aren't as strong. You can almost hit 100 range with Full Bore, Ricochet, Well Rounded 2x, and Fragile Focus, but that sacrifices Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction for only 23m of range." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "High-Impact Frames are generally regarded as the best rocket archetype to use. Great blast radius for splash damage. Semiotician doesn't have any incredible AoE perks like Chain Reaction or Cluster Bomb for multikills but it does have Explosive Light to max out the blast radius, it's easy enough to get orbs, and you'll be able to nuke supers with Explosive Light." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:mkb,pvp

// The Eremite - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "I'm sure most people have seen u/Legoleflash's new video on the Eremite (if you haven't, go watch it https://youtu.be/csuxec3lFcs). Essentially the main point is enhanced Slickdraw doesn't feel terrible and allows you to full send into range. With Slickdraw maxing out your handling you can even opt for handling reducing perks like Full Bore, or, better yet, Extended Barrel for a bump in recoil direction. If you don't like Slickdraw there you could opt for Offhand Strike and find a good balance of range and stability." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Locus Locutus - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP Thoughtless is hands down better. Thoughtless can roll Snapshot or Headstone. Perpetual Motion for a better handling bonus. The only reason you want to use Locus Locutus over Thoughtless is due to Opening Shot being stacked on Keep Away. This way you can stack fully into handling as enhanced Opening Shot and Keep Away with Accurized Rounds puts you at a flat 100 range. While not the most optimal in most Guardian's eyes, it will still be a solid weapon to use." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Abyss Defiant - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI)." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Oversoul Edict - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP your best bet is to invest fully into reliability perks. Arrowhead / CB mod for recoil direction. Ricochet Rounds for stability. Keep Away for more range and some extra accuracy. Headseeker to keep those bursts consistent. If you play a bit more aggressively I can see Eye of the Storm being a great additional perk but it’s not my first choice." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Swordbreaker - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Swordbreaker is interesting. It might take the place of the best lightweight frame shotgun. Being craftable, tying with the highest handling within its archetype, and being able to hit 100 range are just a few things that makes Swordbreaker interesting. You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Precision frame hand cannons are not meta in PvP. Killing Wind and a damage perk can make you competitive after a kill, but that’s just it. It has to be after an initial kill. For most players a 120 or a 140 will do better, just keep in mind a grenade kill with Adrenaline Junkie puts you a 0.67s TtK only requiring 2 crits and 1 body shot. // A Distant Pull
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. Rapid-Fire Frame(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "A Distant Pull is not going to be great in the Crucible. You can roll some really high handling, but without Snapshot Sights, some players won’t even look at it, and being a rapid-fire other players won’t even equip it. These snipers are not as dominant as they used to be before their double body nerf and haven’t seen the sun since. Moving Target and Opening Shot will bump up your aim assist to 100 and you can craft this sniper for either 90 range or 90 handling. While it has some amazing stats, the frame and lack of snapshot will just put it under." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Age-Old Bond
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. High-Impact Frame(360) Void Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP there are simply better options right now. Unlocking the patterns and getting them ready in the event of a buff would be wise, but quick killing weapons with good forgiveness coupled with Target Lock are the name of the game. Age-Old Bond kills quickly but does not have much in terms of forgiveness. Target Lock drops your 6 crit requirement down to 5 crit 1 body, not changing the time to kill, but making it ever so slightly more forgiving. With a bigger buff like Kill Clip you drop an entire shot needed to 4 crit 1 body. Not the most meta option." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Apex Predator
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Velocity. Adaptive Frame(20) Solar Rocket Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "Apex Predator is the best rocket launcher in the game. With enhanced Reconstruction you can almost always have a rocket ready to fire at any given time. With Explosive Light you get incredible amounts of damage and orbs are easy to make now. Bait and Switch is another great damage perk and does more damage, but I find Explosive Light easier to work with, especially with the new mod system revolving around orbs of power. Simple answer is, use Explosive Light if you’re lazy, if you’re trying to min-max use Bait and Switch." |tags:pvp,mkb

Ricochet Rounds gives a great boost to stability and range, Perpetual Motion will bring up a few more stats. // Epochal Integration
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. Adaptive Frame(140) Solar Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "Epochal is honestly a great PvP gun. The issue is mostly the other guns it has to compete against. Palindrome and Exalted Truth are stat monsters and basically bully Epochal Integration into obscurity. It will be great if you never earned either of those hand cannons and is a good stepping stone for newer players. I wouldn’t use this if you know you have better guns in your vault." |tags:pvp,mkb

Making this a really strong contender for being the most consistent high-impact fusion in the game. // Mercurial Overreach
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. Adaptive Frame(90) Arc Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you’ll find a lot of Guardians opting for the tried and true Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot Combo. With the right investments (aka all handling) you can have the most coveted sniper perks alongside 92 handling. Almost making this the fastest sniper in the game, but certainly one with both Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot at the same time. The Supremacy can also reach 92, but that’s on a rapid-fire frame. Defiance of Yasmin (Harrowed) can reach 82 but that is with adept mods. Silicon Neuroma (Adept) is the highest aggressive frame at 59. On an adaptive sniper, this is the highest handling you can get without using things like Dragon’s Shadow, Ophidians, or even Slickdraw." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Nation of Beasts
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive Frame(140) Arc Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "There aren’t a lot of hand cannons that see top tier usage in PvP. Opening Shot, Keep Away, and Perpetual Motion in one column, and Explosive Payload and Kill Clip in the other make for a stacked package. Add in enhanced perks and you have a recipe for a super solid hand cannon. Eye of the Storm or Fragile Focus would round out the mix for best perks on a hand cannon, but overall it’s a solid choice. Hard to say if this is stronger than Palindrome and Exalted Truth, but it certainly holds its own. You’ll have to fight some of the weird gun model though." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Old Sterling
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive Frame(600) Strand Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Adaptive autos have not been meta in quite a while. It was back when Hard Light was too strong that adaptive autos felt like they had a place. What a weird time to be playing Destiny. It was like a light show all the time in PvP. Nowadays you’re going to have to do a lot to make adaptive autos feel strong. Surplus will bring up all your stats. Harmony when paired with a special weapon can also make multikills feel like a breeze if you couple the two. A fast handling, good feeling auto with a damage bump. Takes a lot to make this auto work, but I’m sure someone wants to." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Randy's Throwing Knife
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Stability or Handling. Rapid-Fire Frame(260) Kinetic Scout Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Randy’s Throwing Knife did find its slight niche within PvP, hopefully the new version delivers. I think it does and then some. The old version had Rapid Hit and Kill Clip, which you can get again, but with Extended Mag instead of a better mag boosting perk. You also have the option of bumping up the recoil direction making those quick headshots a lot easier. While the old Randy’s Throwing Knife didn’t have a bad roll, getting it again with slightly better options feels good." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Techeun Force
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive Frame(660) Arc Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you could also recommend Techeun Force as the best fusion in the game and I will. Arrowhead Brake with a CB mod brings the recoil to 100, so you can invest the rest of the fusion into range via Projection Fuse and Rangefinder. If you value kill chaining you could go for Reconstruction and Controlled Burst for never reloading and getting that 20% damage increase. Another niche use case would be Kill Clip and Kickstart for a nice 4 bolt kill, you’d have to be sprinting immediately after reloading but the enhanced version extending Kill Clip’s timer will help you out." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Transfiguration
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. High-Impact Frame(150) Kinetic Scout Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP there aren’t a ton of reasons to use a high-impact scout. Jade Rabbit and Polaris Lance were dominant but not as strong any more. The rise and fall of scouts are typically accompanied by a slower game, pulses and SMGs are dominant right now because you’re either playing passively or aggressively, there aren’t too many middle avenues. Scouts cater to the former but on a higher end. If you do want to try this scout out in PvP you will need more than just Explosive Payload and some prayers." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Tyranny of Heaven
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Draw Time. Lightweight Frame(580) Solar Combat Bow Primary Ammo.  "In PvP please just don’t use bows. The only way to one shot a guardian in PvP is by stacking 3 surge mods with Swashbuckler, or getting Golden Tricorn 2x going. While it is possible, and arguably sustainable within PvP it is incredibly niche. // The Title
//notes:SirStallion_ (PvP / M+KB): "Now you might be thinking "Stal, you put Arrowhead on all 3 rolls and haven't mentioned it. WHY. The gun has 85 RD, it doesn't need +30, +10 is enough if you absolutely want more, or you can use counterbalance." That's all true, but those don't also give +10 handling. // Taraxippos
//notes:SirStallion_ (PvP / M+KB): "I just need to shoutout that Kill Clip is right there in slot 4 also, and that would be great too. However, my thought process with this roll is that I want to make any given engagement as easy for me as possible (High stab, Zen Moment) while also being as much of a nuisance for the enemy as I can (Low flinch intake, Explosive Payload) So while I do think the KC 3 taps will go hard, I'm here to be a menace, not a slayer. [...] While MnK won't actively benefit from Stability as much as Controller, the flinch resist is gonna be a big deal for this roll to work. So it may feel strange at first, but trust the process" Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=2387244414,3038247973,3230963543,839105230

// Astral Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,mkb

Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Basso Ostinato
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range or Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Void Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Basso Ostinato does not compete well in PvP. Opening Shot does make up one of the two incredible shotgun perks. //notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you can get a roll identical to Father’s Sins and similar to Praedyth’s Revenge. //notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Rapid-Fire(500) Arc Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "Over in the Crucible void mains will be happy. Under Pressure and Elemental Capacitor will make this weapon feel like it doesn’t move. Another incredible combo would be Under Pressure and Kickstart. Pair those two with heavy investments into charge time and you will have a 336ms anti-shotgun. This might almost fire so quickly you won’t be able to precharge as often or aim as well. Another issue is you have to be sliding which on MnK you can slide180 our controller players will not be able to as reliably. Making this lean more towards one input over another." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Jorum's Claw
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(390) Solar Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you’re really looking for consistency. The adaptive frame pulse rifles can two-burst with any damage bonus. This makes Kill Clip highly sought-after but having a more neutral pulse and surge mods can make this weapon also two-burst. With one surge mod you can two-burst all the way up to 7 resilience. Requiring all headshots. With two surge mods you can two-burst up to 8 resilience. 9 resilience with all three surge mods. Tier 10 will never get two bursted without Kill Clip but it’s nice to know if your RNG doesn’t favor you." |tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Rapid-Fire(150) Solar Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In the crucible you might want a different grenade launcher. Perpetual Motion is the best in slot for column three and Impulse Amplifier is the best for Column four. On other grenade launchers like Memory Interdict you can roll Impulse Amplifier with a better fourth column perk for either damage or consistency. Marsilion-C is great if you don’t have a grenade launcher for PvP but I would not rely on it being the best." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Mykel's Reverence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Rapid-Fire(450) Strand Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "In PvP being a rapid-fire frame means this sidearm has extremely limited range. It will shut down shotgun apes and fusion rushers with ease but it does mean you are hard capped at around 15m of range. Being able to bring up the stability will make putting down those rushers easier but it will still require 5 crits and a body shot to kill 10 resilience Guardians. High risk decent reward." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Phyllotactic Spiral
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. High-Impact(340) Arc Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can run a counterbalance mod or Arrowhead Brake if you prefer a different mod. Keep Away is the in slot and paired with Headseeker you will have a great neutral pulse rifle. If you get the jump on someone you’ll have the bonus range and a near perfect first burst. They turn on you, start flinching you, headseeker then comes into play to keep you on that two-burst. Kill Clip is another viable option for a more forgiving two-burst after your first kill, especially when paired with Tunnel Vision. Elemental Capacitor will only accentuate the neutral game of this pulse no matter what subclass you use. Whatever you use this pulse will be a great addition to any vault." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Round Robin
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Stability. Aggressive(120) Strand Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "In PvE Subsistence with Golden Tricorn will be your bread and butter for never ending shooting and a huge damage buff. This works with a build that ability loops by itself like Heart of Inmost Light. If you can keep up Golden Tricorn 2x constantly you will have an incredibly high damage hand cannon. Envious Assassin is an interesting perk as you’ll need to swap off your primary to get kills to overflow your magazine to swap back to your primary. If you are running double primary weapons in higher end content or just like to switch up weapons for clearing rooms you will love this perk. However, I just find it odd to need to swap off your primary to overflow your primary." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Senuna SI6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Omolon Adaptive(491) Stasis Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Senuna SI6 is arguably the best three-burst sidearm. Slickdraw gives you 100 handling. A counterbalance mod gives you 99 recoil direction. You can then invest entirely into range as Omolon Fluid Dynamics will give you your stability. The only issue is the fourth column perk. Headstone is great in 3v3. Elemental Capacitor can bump up your stability on void, or forgo a counterbalance mod on Stasis. If you jump a lot then Strand could be a great option for you. Headseeker is another good option. Ideally I would run Headstone just for locking down that position and having some cover as well. Certainly a gun I will farm for and then throw in my vault to use on random loadout shenanigans." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Mykel's Reverence - Mykel's Reverence (mnk,pvp)
//notes: Due to its high base stability, you want to focus on getting as much range as possible. This makes Hammer-Forged Rifling, Full Bore, or Small Bore the best barrels. For magazine options: Ricochet or High-Caliber Rounds for the extra range with bonuses to stability/increasing flinch, respectively. The best perk in the first column is Perpetual Motion due to the bonus effects it grants when moving. The second column of perks has a wider range of perks that can be used. For general use, Swashbuckler or Tap the Trigger are the go-to options. Strand users can find great value in the Hatchling perk.|tags:mnk,pvp
dimwishlist:item=231031173&perks=1428297954,1885400500,1890422124,3250034553
dimwishlist:item=231031173&perks=1428297954,1885400500,3250034553,4082225868

// Briar's Contempt - Briar's Contempt (pvp,mnk)
//notes: For PvP, handling and accuracy are the two most important factors for a linear fusion rifle. Hence, Fluted Barrel is the best barrel due to the large bump in handling. Particle Repeater or Projection Fuse are the best magazine choices due to the flat bump in stats they give to stability/range, respectively. For column 1 perks, Keep Away is the stand-out choice. Keep Away provides several buffs for keeping your distance, most noticeably an increase in weapon accuracy. Paired with High Impact Reserves makes Briar’s Contempt a good option for a ranged heavy.|tags:pvp,mnk
dimwishlist:item=1491665733&perks=1840239774,2213355989,2969185026,3619207468

// Aurvandil FR6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP there aren't a lot of pros for high-impact fusions. They are certainly strong and they are my favorites to use. But the charge time increase really hurt their overall utility. The change to 5 bolts was nice, but not having high-impact reserves in this weapons perk pool is a bit of a let down. Elemental capacitor can make it feel super consistent on void, arc or stasis. Firmly planted will make the shot you do take incredibly consistent, void or not." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Fioritura-59
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Rapid-fire frame sidearms are the biggest Uno Reverse card for shotgun rushers. Spray them down and you don’t need a lot of range to do so. Fioritura-59 has great lethality perks and will serve well in a very aggressive play style but will be hard countered by anyone walking backwards." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Wilderflight
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "I don’t know how to feel about Wilderflight in PvP. Technically you can do more damage with double impact, and have some forgiveness with proximity grenades. But it also means that the architecture can really mess you up if you go to bounce shot and it splits the grenades into two different directions. I have yet to fully test out the full damage of each grenade, but disruption break will still probably be then play. Being able to hit one grenade and break a shield will give your kinetic 50% more damage which will definitely drop any guardian with ease." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Disparity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Taking that fantastic base and transitioning it over to the crucible is easy. Most of the weapon stays the same. Arrowhead and rapid hit are the foundation. Steady rounds for more stability, or accurized rounds for even more range is your preference. In the last column you have three separate ways you can go. Kill clip is the easiest to use and helps make the second kill easier as you won’t need as many critical hits. Headseeker is my pick for overall neutral play. Desperado is great for kill chaining in 6v6 but I wouldn’t use it in 3v3." Recommended MW - Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Trace rifles have had a very small but solid cult following. Path of Least Resistance doesn’t offer a lot in terms of lethality to keep the ball rolling once it does get started. Neutrally it is very strong but I think PvE is where it will survive." // Fire and Forget
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In terms of using fire and forget in PvP. It’s kind of a mixed bag. It can definitely feel good and has some forgiveness you don’t really find on heavy weapons. I like aggressive bursts for PvP but I don’t find myself reaching for them often. Maybe a crafted version will change that. Go for as low of a charge time with as high handling and as much range you can fit into this wonderfully sexy weapon. Rangefinder will help keep aim assist at range, and high-impact reserves will help if you miss part of the burst." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Retrofit Escapade
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Let me issue you a challenge. If you kill me in PvP with this weapon I will uninstall Destiny 2. [...] In other news, go for consistency perks as the base stats are so low they are almost non-existent. Arrowhead break will make the recoil easier. Accurized rounds will push out your effective range. Heating up will better your stability and recoil direction further, but you have to get a kill first. Tap the trigger won’t last long, but will help you get some damage on target." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=1570042021,1890422124,3142289711,839105230
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=1570042021,3142289711,3425386926,839105230

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Precision frame hand cannons did get a slight buff recently. They are consistent but just as underwhelming in PvP. I cannot undervalue their easy recoil control, but they are outclassed in almost all other aspects. Rapid hit will make shooting a breeze, and rampage is enough to 3-crit up to 9 resilience." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1731355324&perks=247725512,3142289711,3250034553,3425386926

// IKELOS_SG_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rapid-fire frame shotguns have not had a strong presence in PvP either. Their recent change to a fixed spread will help but their poor ammo economy on top of the gamemodes 1 shot per brick leads to a bad taste. They can be strong when barrel stuffing your opponent, but any shotgun will do then. I would just stay away from rapid-fire shotguns until there is a really strong incentive to use them." Recommended MW - Handling or Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_SR_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP you will have to decide if this sniper is good enough. Snipers are incredibly personal and what works for one person will not always work for others. The zoom, the scope, the feel will all determine your success. Elemental capacitor on arc subclasses will maximize your handling, but elemental capacitor on stasis or void is another great option for movement speed and stability, respectively." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Disparity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Taking that fantastic base and transitioning it over to the crucible is easy. Most of the weapon stays the same. Arrowhead and rapid hit are the foundation. Steady rounds for more stability, or accurized rounds for even more range is your preference. In the last column you have three separate ways you can go. Kill clip is the easiest to use and helps make the second kill easier as you won’t need as many critical hits. Headseeker is my pick for overall neutral play. Desperado is great for kill chaining in 6v6 but I wouldn’t use it in 3v3." Recommended MW - Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Trace rifles have had a very small but solid cult following. Path of Least Resistance doesn’t offer a lot in terms of lethality to keep the ball rolling once it does get started. Neutrally it is very strong but I think PvE is where it will survive." // Fire and Forget
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In terms of using fire and forget in PvP. It’s kind of a mixed bag. It can definitely feel good and has some forgiveness you don’t really find on heavy weapons. I like aggressive bursts for PvP but I don’t find myself reaching for them often. Maybe a crafted version will change that. Go for as low of a charge time with as high handling and as much range you can fit into this wonderfully sexy weapon. Rangefinder will help keep aim assist at range, and high-impact reserves will help if you miss part of the burst." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Retrofit Escapade
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Let me issue you a challenge. If you kill me in PvP with this weapon I will uninstall Destiny 2. [...] In other news, go for consistency perks as the base stats are so low they are almost non-existent. Arrowhead break will make the recoil easier. Accurized rounds will push out your effective range. Heating up will better your stability and recoil direction further, but you have to get a kill first. Tap the trigger won’t last long, but will help you get some damage on target." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Precision frame hand cannons did get a slight buff recently. They are consistent but just as underwhelming in PvP. I cannot undervalue their easy recoil control, but they are outclassed in almost all other aspects. Rapid hit will make shooting a breeze, and rampage is enough to 3-crit up to 9 resilience." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// IKELOS_SG_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rapid-fire frame shotguns have not had a strong presence in PvP either. Their recent change to a fixed spread will help but their poor ammo economy on top of the gamemodes 1 shot per brick leads to a bad taste. They can be strong when barrel stuffing your opponent, but any shotgun will do then. I would just stay away from rapid-fire shotguns until there is a really strong incentive to use them." Recommended MW - Handling or Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_SR_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP you will have to decide if this sniper is good enough. Snipers are incredibly personal and what works for one person will not always work for others. The zoom, the scope, the feel will all determine your success. Elemental capacitor on arc subclasses will maximize your handling, but elemental capacitor on stasis or void is another great option for movement speed and stability, respectively." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Veles-X
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Veles-X will still have some incredible usefulness in PvP as well. Tunnel vision and kill clip are perfect with one another. At base you have an incredible pulse that can two burst. With kill clip it makes that two burst more forgiving but you also have tunnel vision for more aim assist. With the recent change to kill clip and tunnel vision, both can be refreshed so it keeps both perks active whenever you get a kill." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2276328320&perks=1015611457,2946784966,3230963543,3661387068

Elemental capacitor will certainly help with that. Perpetual motion and moving target are also both incredible perks on snipers, one boosting low stats, the other adding forgiveness through aim assist." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Prolonged Engagement
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Unfortunately for Prolonged Engagement it won’t see a lot of use outside of PvE. Having 14 zoom makes it firmly middle of the pack and having the lowest base range in its class (technically Escape Velocity is lower, but Escape Velocity also gets sights, not barrels) doesn’t help it. What it lacks in range it does make up for in stability, being on the upper percentile. It also has some of the best aim assist for its archetype. Rangefinder is definitely a must, as is pushing up the range. Hammer-forged rifling or smallbore is going to be key, but don’t decrease other stats just to increase your range." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Wendigo GL3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Wendigo is interesting in PvP. I wouldn’t use it, but I also wouldn’t be upset with someone if they did. It has utility and it can work similar to other grenade launchers. Proximity grenades adds forgiveness and flexibility. Impulse amplifier makes it more of a pocket rocket launcher, and rangefinder will just make whatever arc the grenade has minimal. Another good shout is explosive light. If you hold onto your explosive light shots, or build it up without having power ammo, you will have even more flexibility with the added damage, and be able to counter supers with ease." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Blowout
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Blowout is an interesting core playlist weapon. Being a rocket launcher there isn’t much you want in PvP. You want your rocket to go where you’re shooting so either impulse amplifier for the zoom or tracking module to ensure it gets to where it should be. Then you want to make sure your one rocket counts so you choose chain reaction or cluster bomb. There really isn’t a lot to think about when it comes to PvP rockets." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Dark Decider
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "For PvP Dark Decider fits into a weird spot. It has some of the lowest base stats within its archetypes but some of the most unique perks that can put it well above the rest. For one, it is the only rapid-fire frame to roll rangefinder. Putting it in a range class well above its stats. It can also roll Iron Grip for a whopping +20 stability without sacrificing your barrel and magazine perks to stability. The only other auto rifle in this class to compete with Dark Decider would be Krait and given comparable rolls (DD - hammer-forged, accurized, iron grip, rangefinder / K - hammer-forged, ricochet, overflow, moving target) Dark Decider would have 2 whole meters over Krait. Which is a lot within the auto rifle space." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=540880995&perks=1359896290,2846385770,3142289711,839105230
dimwishlist:item=540880995&perks=11551321,2846385770,3142289711,839105230

dimwishlist:item=540880995&perks=11551321,3142289711,591790007,839105230

// Gunnora’s Axe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "With the current state of slug shotguns, you do want to go for as much range as possible while maintaining as high of handling as possible. Fluted barrel or hammer-forged rifling are your best options for barrels. Accurized is the only choice as for whatever reason Gunnora’s Axe doesn’t get access to assault mag. Threat detector and opening shot are the S tier combo to get. Iron reach and moving target are decent substitutes as long as you have the handling to back it up." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Rose
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Rose is the hotness if you’re into using hand cannons in the crucible. Being a stand-alone archetype of a relic long thought lost. Rose has the intrinsic lightweight bonus (+20 mobility) and it also has access to grips over an origin trait. The unique archetype will feel right at home with crucible affectionados and the grips can make up for some extra stats. Rose will excel if you bump up handling, stability and, most importantly, range. I would still not sacrifice other stats to make up for range, but if you happen to get more range I would take it." Recommended Grips - Grip: Smooth Grip, Polymer Grip, Combat Grip. Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=882778888&perks=247725512,3142289711,3250034553,699525795

// Veles-X
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Veles-X will still have some incredible usefulness in PvP as well. Tunnel vision and kill clip are perfect with one another. At base you have an incredible pulse that can two burst. With kill clip it makes that two burst more forgiving but you also have tunnel vision for more aim assist. With the recent change to kill clip and tunnel vision, both can be refreshed so it keeps both perks active whenever you get a kill." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Glacioclasm
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP it’s all about stacking as many consistency perks as possible. Lowering the charge time via accelerated coils and charge time MW so you won’t have to pre-charge as long. Arrowhead to make tracking easier. Under pressure for the most accuracy bonuses. High-impact reserves for some damage bonuses. It’s not going to be as quick as Midha’s Reckoning but it can get close and feel just as strong." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

//notes:/u/SirStallion_ (PvP / M+KB / Controller): While the main traits are obvious picks as far as this weapon is concerned, the rest is a little confusing. // Jurassic Green (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Perpetual Motion, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Take your choice of the combat-effect mag perks in your mag slot. For endgame use, Perpetual Motion boosts gunfeel stats passively and Frenzy provides a decent 15% damage boost in combat. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvP-EndGame, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvP-EndGame, Controller, MKB

// BrayTech Werewolf (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Tap the Trigger
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. The Origin Trait is aimed more at 3v3 game modes, where you're less likely to be near a team mate to gain the better ADS and strafe speed. A competitive subfamily TTK of 0.8s if you can hit 6 crits and 1 body shot, and a not-awful accuracy-adjusted TTK of 0.93s (4c, 4b) as at v6.2.5. Decent stats within the subfamily. Ignore the recoil direction, as this is a precision frame, so you can use the barrel to fill in your favoured stat - this does have the lowest zoom of its peers so you can either try and compensate with range, or live with it and improve stability. Ricochet Rounds adds range and stability, and is your best mag choice. For duelling, you don't really need to look further than Dynamic Sway Reduction and Tap the Trigger which together add stability and accuracy through your volley. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, MKB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2869466318&perks=1359896290,1840239774,1885400500,1890422124
dimwishlist:item=2869466318&perks=1359896290,1885400500,1890422124,4090651448

// BrayTech Werewolf (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvP pick for kill-chaining. The Origin Trait is aimed more at 3v3 game modes, where you're less likely to be near a team mate to gain the better ADS and strafe speed. A competitive subfamily TTK of 0.8s if you can hit 6 crits and 1 body shot, and a not-awful accuracy-adjusted TTK of 0.93s (4c, 4b) as at v6.2.5. Decent stats within the subfamily. Ignore the recoil direction, as this is a precision frame, so you can use the barrel to fill in your favoured stat - this does have the lowest zoom of its peers so you can either try and compensate with range, or live with it and improve stability. Ricochet Rounds adds range and stability, and is your best mag choice. For kill-chaining, Swashbuckler x5 after a melee kill reduces TTK to 0.67 (4c, 2b), while Pugilist turns this into a legendary "Monte Carlo-lite", recovering melee ability energy to repeat the cycle. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, MKB, Controller

// Jurassic Green (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel), Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining, particularly for solar subclasses. The Origin Trait is aimed more at 3v3 game modes, where you're less likely to be near a team mate to gain the better ADS and strafe speed. Reasonably competitive out of the box with a subfamily TTK of 0.8s with 8 crits and 1 body shot), and an accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.00s (7c, 3b) which only needs the smallest of damage boosts to improve as at v6.2.5. Unfortunately, stats are pretty weak across the board - the 50 Recoil Direction and joint lowest zoom means that, even with a recoil direction-correcting or stability barrel, you'll will still probably find a Counterbalance mod necessary. You really need both more range and more stability, once you've sorted the recoil direction, so Ricochet Rounds are your best mag perk. In the first trait column, Rangefinder will help push out range with an extra point of zoom. The second trait column is a bit short on PvP picks, but Golden Tricorn is the most reliable damage perk. One stack after a kill drops TTK down to 0.73s (7c, 1b) and accuracy-adjusted TTK to 0.8s (5c, 4b). If you manage to proc both stacks, this drops further to a lightning-fast TTK of 0.47s (6c) or an accuracy-adjusted TTK of 0.67s (4c, 3b). Recommended MW: Stability, with a Counterbalance mod.|tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, MKB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2603335652&perks=1885400500,2610012052,2846385770,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2603335652&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2610012052,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=2603335652&perks=1840239774,1885400500,2610012052,2846385770

// Eyasluna (PvP first-choice roll)
// (SteadyHand HCS, FastDraw HCS), Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Snapshot Sights
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Great hand cannon - probably best in class, with great stats across the board. Out-of-the-box TTK of 0.87s with 3 crits, or accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.3s with 2 crits, 2 body shots, as at v6.2.5. You can boost Handling and Stability with sights - Steadyhand and FastDraw are your best options, and Ricochet Rounds is your optimum magazine perk. Then, for duelling, Rangefinder pushes out your range to near pulse rifle distances, and Snapshot Sights halves your ADS time to get the crucial first shot in an engagement. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, MKB, Controller

// Eyasluna (PvP first-choice roll)
// (SteadyHand HCS, FastDraw HCS), Ricochet Rounds, (Rapid Hit, Outlaw), Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Great hand cannon - probably best in class, with great stats across the board. Out-of-the-box TTK of 0.87s with 3 crits, or accuracy-adjusted TTK of 1.3s with 2 crits, 2 body shots, as at v6.2.5. You can boost Handling and Stability with sights - Steadyhand and FastDraw are your best options, and  Ricochet Rounds is your optimum magazine perk. Then, for kill-chaining, Rapid Hit or Outlaw reward crits with a fast reload to take advantage of Kill Clip, which makes the three-tap much easier, just needing 1 crit and 2 body shots. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, MKB, Controller

// Eyasluna (PvP first-choice roll)
// (SteadyHand HCS, FastDraw HCS), Ricochet Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Harmony
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Great hand cannon - probably best in class, with great stats across the board. You can boost Handling and Stability with sights - Steadyhand and FastDraw are your best options, and Ricochet Rounds is your optimum magazine perk. Then for kill-chaining, you can proc Perpetual Motion on a stowed weapon to improve Handling for a faster swap after a special or power weapon kill, and Harmony will make your three-tap easier, needing just two crits and a body to kill at any resilience. // BxR-55 Battler (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), Ricochet Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Eye of the Storm
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Just great stats across the board, plus the unique hipfire boost from the frame make the Battler a top choice for PvP. You're always likely to be taking damage, so the Hot Swap origin perk will be useful too. Out-of-the-box, this has the same TTK as a lightweight - 0.87s with 7 crits and 1 body, or an accuracy-adjusted TTK in 0.93s (6c, 3b), as at v6.2.5. It does have wonky recoil, which Arrowhead Brake sorts out completely, but extra stability plus the 20 Zoom also makes it controllable. Ricochet Rounds, is the reliable mag perk of choice. Then, for duelling, Perpetual Motion boosts your gunfeel stats and Eye of the Storm makes crits easier to hit in a firefight. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Freehand Grip, Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, MKB, Controller

//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 280 with @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining, particularly for melee builds. Shapeable. Just great stats across the board, plus the unique hipfire boost from the frame make the Battler a top choice for PvP. You're always likely to be taking damage, so the Hot Swap origin perk will be useful too. Out-of-the-box, this has the same TTK as a lightweight - 0.87s with 7 crits and 1 body, or an accuracy-adjusted TTK in 0.93s (6c, 3b), as at v6.2.5. It does have wonky recoil, which Arrowhead Brake sorts out completely, but extra stability plus the 20 Zoom also makes it controllable. Ricochet Rounds, is the reliable mag perk of choice. For melee builds, Pugilist and Blunt Execution Rounds provide a fun play loop - charged or uncharged melee hits (ones that don't need a sprint or slide, sorry Titans) on opponents within 15m proc Blunt Execution Rounds, which makes killing the damaged opponent very easy with the hipfire perk, which procs Pugilist to repeat the process. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Freehand Grip, Quick Access Sling, Sprint Grip or Targeting Adjuster mod depending on your preference.|tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, MKB, Controller

// Jurassic Green (pvp)
//notes:WarlockMaggie (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Jurassic Green is back with new perks and an intrinsic trait. Unfortunately, Jurassic continues to be plagued with lowest-in-archetype stats nearly across the board. Improving recoil direction, increasing stability and handling, and building out a perk combo is going to be your plan for making this gun work for you." Recommended MW: Handling or Stability|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
